function.name: get_news
function.description: Fetch top news headlines by category and country. ONLY use this when the user explicitly asks for news, current events, or headlines. Do not use for historical information or general knowledge questions.

category.description: The news category to fetch. Use 'technology' for tech news, 'business' for financial/business news, 'general' for top headlines across all categories.

country.description: Two-letter country code (ISO 3166-1). Examples: 'us' for USA, 'in' for India, 'gb' for UK, 'ca' for Canada. Defaults to 'us' if not specified.

save_file.description: Whether to save the news data to a JSON file. Set to true only if user explicitly asks to save or download the news.

function.name: get_weather
function.description: Get current weather information for a specific city or location. ONLY use this when the user explicitly asks about weather, temperature, or forecast for a specific place.

place.description: The name of the city or location (e.g., 'London', 'Tokyo', 'New York')

function.name: get_datetime
function.description: Get the current date, time, day of the week, and timezone. ONLY use this when the user explicitly asks what time it is, what date it is, or what day it is right now.

function.name: wiki_search
function.description: Search Wikipedia for pages matching a given query. Returns a list of page titles that match the search term. Use this when the user wants to find Wikipedia articles or explore what pages are available on a topic.

word.description: The search term or query to look up on Wikipedia (e.g., 'Python programming', 'Albert Einstein')

function.name: wiki_summary
function.description: Get a brief summary of a Wikipedia page. Returns the first few sentences/paragraphs of the article. Use this when the user asks for a quick overview, summary, or basic information about a topic.

word.description: The exact Wikipedia page title or topic to get a summary for (e.g., 'Tirupati', 'Artificial Intelligence')

function.name: wiki_content
function.description: Retrieve the full content and title of a Wikipedia page. Returns a dictionary with 'title' and 'content' keys containing the complete article text. WARNING: This returns large amounts of text and may increase token usage significantly. Use wiki_summary instead unless the user explicitly needs the full article.

word.description: The exact Wikipedia page title to retrieve full content from (e.g., 'Python (programming language)')
